data.title: Cargo services and operations
data.meta_description: We work with partners to ensure our international supply chains are as efficient as possible.
data.text:
Edinburgh Airport is home to Scotland's largest air cargo gateway, facilitating international trade on both passenger and dedicated cargo movements.

We're proud to work with many of the world's leading names in logistics and aviation partners to make Scotland's international supply chains as efficient as possible.

Scotland is a great place to do business with a strong focus on exports from a range of industries including food and drink, pharmaceuticals and life sciences, aerospace and energy sectors among others. With a desire to grow exports, Scotland is seeking enhanced connectivity to global trading partners for which air freight is a vital component for reliable international supply chains.

The airport is well located to support air cargo requirements - it is centrally located for Scotland's major conurbations from Aberdeen to Glasgow, with daily connections to the Highlands and Islands via air routes also.

Edinburgh Airport is now developing Global Air Park; a 28-acre logistics park which will enhance Scottish logistics and facilitate global trade from the country's capital city airport.

Find out more about what we've got to offer, along with more information on our Global Air Parks project, and plans to decarbonise our airport using the drop-down sections below.

Want to know more?

If you're interested in finding out more simply fill in the form below to receive a brochure containing details of all our services and partners. You'll also find contact details and next steps if you're interested in doing business with us.
